inclusion.criterion: Suspicion of malignant biliary stricture without prior histopathologic confirmation
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Informed consent for ERCP, including sampling and dilation modalities, obtained.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ERCP with biliary decompression will be performed with standard techniques.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Tissue sampling will be performed in the order assigned by randomization, according to the following technique:
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Brush: the RX-cytology brush (M00545000, Boston Scientific Corp., Natick, Mass.) will be passed as a unit within its 8 French sheath, over the guidewire through the stricture.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: G.I.U.M.: immediately before using the G.I.U.M. catheter, the biliary stricture will be dilated using a 6-mm in diameter MaxForce balloon catheter (Microvasive Endoscopy, Boston Sc.).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Smears as well as the 2 vials of saline and the 2 vials of CytoLytt will be labeled with the patient's name and the mark "G.I.U.M." or "brush".
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Complications possibly detected during ERCP or during the 30 following days will be noted and assessed by using established consensus criteria.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Preparation of tissue sample Cytolytt vials: specimens in Cytolytt will be prepared according to the manufacturer's instructions.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Coagulopathy not corrected by administration of vitamin K or fresh frozen plasma;
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Inability to pass a guidewire through the stricture;
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of BPH and multiple urological procedures, including suprapubic prostatectomy. He has a severe 2cm bulbar urethral stricture that requires surgical fixation.
